Pull quotes

Pull quotes

Display a stylised quote or important content.

On this page
  • Visual design
  • Guidelines for use
  • Layouts
  • Examples and assets

Visual design

Design view:

Mobile design

Desktop designs can be viewed on screens wider than 650px.

Block quotes are centered in the middle of the page like this.

Chloe Richardson, Product Owner, business.gov.au

CSS styles

Desktop & mobile

Grant status icon and text
p.status {
    color: #333333;
    font-family: OpenSans-Semibold;
    font-size: 18px;
    line-height: 32px;
}


.icon-closed {
    color: #E75755;
    height: 24px;
    width: 24px;
}
Grant information
p.details {
    color: #333333;
    font-family: OpenSans;
    font-size: 16px;
    line-height: 28px;
}
p.details strong {
    font-family: OpenSans-Semibold;
}

Guidelines for use

Purpose:

Used to display a stylised quote or important content.

When to use this component:

  • On pages that include content that is attributed to a specific person. Most often used as part of Customer Story pages.
  • On business information content pages to highlight an example or key point.

Content rules

  • Include full name, position and name of company if relevant for direct quotes.

Layouts

Page layouts

Pull quotes are used in two-third width pages.

Component layout options

Full width layout

Desktop, Tablet & Mobile: One component in a row.

Examples and assets

View the pull quote component on business.gov.au

BUSINESS.GOV.AU

We acknowledge the traditional owners of the country throughout Australia and their continuing connection to land, sea and community. We pay our respect to them and their cultures and to the elders past and present.

© Commonwealth of Australia.
